Articles.Content: I keep seeing people saying that they are using it to help their mods run, could anyone please explain how to use it? I have too many mods that I want to play with, and my game is incredibly unstable, especially when I start adding most of the part mods.
can this be done without steam? I prefer to play kerbal off steam so that when the game updates, it doesn't break my mods.
You can add it to the target box of a shortcut to the KSP.exe, it's a [**Unity game engine command line argument.**](http://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/CommandLineArguments.html)
and what exactly does open gl even do for kerbal?

> 
> and what exactly does open gl even do for kerbal?

It helps the game offload more textures from system memory to the memory on your video card.

Since it's not listed, does this mean the -force-gfx-st switch for AMD Phenoms is no longer used?
